page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN THE EGMERE AREA
page.content: There are no{classified roads}in the area, but it is traversed by two roads of reasonable standard. The road from Fakenham to Wells, known locally as {the 'dry' road}(no pubs on this route!), carries the bulk of heavy traffic to Seaman's Mills and on to Wells docks. The second goes from Walsingham to South Creake through Egmere.{Narrow and twisting country {lanes}give access to Quarles and Waterden farms. A few{farm tracks cross the area. There is virtually no public transport. Only a{Community bus travels weekly to Creake and Fakenham. Nearly every family has a{car}and are prepared to offer others transport. Two men have motor cycles. Several ladies and children have cycles to visit the shops about two miles away. Agricultural vehicles frequent these roads.
